cdisc.description: Use the new extension to connect Observation to ResearchStudy.

element.comment:
Mapping is based on presumption that research subject will be tied to site-specific ResearchStudy, which will then be part of overall ResearchStudy.

element.name: Transmission Type

cdisc.label: /GTP/Study/@TransmissionType
cdisc.description: Determine from the type of call to the FHIR service. Requesting all data would be cumulative; requesting only a subset of data, since the last call, is incremental.

element.gap: Determine from type of call to service (requesting all data vs incremental data). NOTE: If data are not persisted between FHIR and LAB, cannot do incremental data processing (due to lack of delta detection).
element.comment: If the data is being 'pushed' in a message, this could also be conveyed in the MessageHeader.event

element.name: Study Transaction Type

cdisc.label: /GTP/Study/TransactionType
cdisc.description: Determining whether transactions are insert or update is a task for the data consumer. NOTE: If data are not persisted between FHIR and LAB, cannot do incremental updates (no delta detection).

element.gap: Determining whether transactions are insert or update is a task for the data consumer. (NOTE: This requires persistent storage to compare current data with data in the incoming file)
element.comment: This would be conveyed using a transaction Bundle - specifically the Bundle.entry.request.method

cdisc.label: /GTP/Study/Site/Investigator/Subject/Sex/@Value
cdisc.description:
Consider whether patient personal information is required for sponsor to perform patient reconciliation. If not, do not send this data element.
Consider whether patient personal information is required for sponsor to perform patient reconciliation. If not, do not send this data element.

element.name: Subject Sex Code List ID

cdisc.label: /GTP/Study/Site/Investigator/Subject/Sex/@CodeListID
cdisc.description: No value exists for this field.

element.gap: For FHIR, the administrative gender code list is fixed, so no need to send it in the instance. If there's a need to convey alternate gender codes, then those would appear either as Observation values or as extension values on Patient (the former for clinical information, the latter for administrative purposes). In either event, the code would be in CodeableConcept.coding which allows identifying both the code system and (if relevant), the version

element.name: Subject Race

cdisc.label: /GTP/Study/Site/Investigator/Subject/Race/@Value
cdisc.description:
Consider whether patient personal information is required for the sponsor to perform patient reconciliation. If not, do not send this data element.
Consider whether patient personal information is required for the sponsor to perform patient reconciliation. If not, do not send this data element.

element.gap: There's an US-core extension (us-core-race) for capturing this in the U.S. and the possibility that other countries will define their own extensions. Note that this is for administrative, not clinical purposes. Genetic heritage would typically be captured as an Observation

element.name: Subject Race Code List ID

cdisc.label: /GTP/Study/Site/Investigator/Subject/Race/@CodeListID
cdisc.description: No value exists for this field.

element.gap: Race, whether captured as an extension or observation value is generally a CodeableConcept allowing capturing both code system and (if relevant) version. Race is highly variable from country to country (both whether it's allowed and how it's coded), so there's no standard element for this in the core spec.

element.name: Subject Initials

cdisc.label: /GTP/Study/Site/Investigator/Subject/Confidential/@Initials
cdisc.description:
Consider whether patient personal information is required for the sponsor to perform patient reconciliation. If not, do not send this data element.
Consider whether patient personal information is required for the sponsor to perform patient reconciliation. If not, do not send this data element.

element.comment: Note that name.text will typically contain the full name, but *can* contain initials only. If the full name is present, initials can be extracted by looking at the given and family name components and converting to initials

element.name: Subject Date Of Birth

cdisc.label: /GTP/Study/Site/Investigator/Subject/Confidential/@Birthdate
cdisc.description: Consider whether patient personal information is required for the sponsor to perform patient reconciliation. If not, do not send this data element.

element.comment: Note that precision can vary (YYYY, YYYY-MM or YYYY-MM-DD)

element.name: Visit ID or Number

cdisc.label: /GTP/Study/Site/Investigator/Subject/Visit/@ID
cdisc.description: Provide the study sponsor's visit identifier.

element.comment: No standard way to decide which identifier to use if multiples are present

element.name: Visit Name

cdisc.label: /GTP/Study/Site/Investigator/Subject/Visit/@Name
cdisc.description: If a sponsor requires the visit name, use the encounter.identifier.value field to fulfill this purpose. Set the encounter.identifier.type.CodeableConcept.text to 'Visit Name'. Alternatively, you can use the Schedule of Activities, within the Protocol (see PlanDefinition resource)

element.gap: In practice, visit name would be the ActivityDefinition.title for the activity in the protocol associated with the encounter. There is no standard extension for this link (though one will be defined). Most clinical systems won't actually capture this, so the determination will need to be made at time of data extraction based on the protocol
element.comment: See LB mapping comment

element.name: Visit Type

cdisc.label: /GTP/Study/Site/Investigator/Subject/Visit/@Type
cdisc.description: Since this is required for the LAB model, we recommend using the contents of the encounter.identifier field to assist with determining the type of visit (scheduled or unscheduled). To store this in FHIR, use the encounter.identifier.value field and set the encounter.identifier.type.CodeableConcept.text to 'Visit Type'.

element.gap: This is essentially whether the visit is tied to a particular activity within the PlanDefinition (study protocol) or not. Given that in non-study-specific systems, there won't typically be a linkage even when the encounter *is* driven by the study, this will generally need to be populated algorithmically on extension
element.comment:
This could theoretically be distinguished by whether there was a link to a CarePlan activity or ActivityDefinition. Alternatively, you could use an extension or tag. (What's 'planned' for one study might be unplanned for another)
This could theoretically be distinguished by whether there was a link to a CarePlan activity or ActivityDefinition. Alternatively, you could use an extension or tag. (What's 'planned' for one study might be unplanned for another)

element.name: Visit Type Modifier

cdisc.label: /GTP/Study/Site/Investigator/Subject/Visit/@TypeModifier
cdisc.description: This is not required for the LAB model. If needed, we recommend using the contents of the encounter.identifier field to assist with determining the type of visit (scheduled or unscheduled). To store this in FHIR, use the encounter.identifier.value field and set the encounter.identifier.type.CodeableConcept.text to 'Visit Type Modifier'.

element.comment: This would be Encounter.reasonCode

element.name: Last Active Date and Time

cdisc.label: /GTP/Study/Site/Investigator/Subject/Visit/Accession/@LastActiveDateTime
cdisc.description: The intention of this field is to hold the local date and time of the last modification made to the accession record at the central laboratory. This includes a Universal Time Offset plus/minus hours and minutes. Since this field is not required by LAB, it will not be sent.

element.gap: FHIR allows capture meta.lastUpdated which reflects when the data last changed on the server in question, but would need to look at Provenance to see when data last changed on a particular system. This typically won't be available.

element.name: Test Type

cdisc.label: /GTP/Study/Site/Investigator/Subject/Visit/Accession/BaseSpecimen/BaseBattery/BaseTest/@TestType
cdisc.description: The intention of this field is to define whether the test was a study test, non-study test, or unscheduled test. The normal transmission of data, via FHIR, is for study tests. If non-study test results are required (e.g., AdverseEvent follow-up), these would be obtained via a special request from the data provider. It may be possible to derive this from the ServiceRequest and (eventually) the PlanDefinition.

element.gap: The normal transmission of data, via FHIR, is for study tests. If non-study test results are required (e.g., AdverseEvent follow-up), these would be obtained via a special request from the data provider. Alternatively, if the system requires this field to be populated, derive whether the test was for the study or not, use the ServiceRequest resource.
element.comment: Differentiation would be whether the Observation was basedOn a particular activity in the CarePlan (scheduled) or tied to a particular ActivityDefinition (Study test)

element.name: Result Class

cdisc.description: Specifies whether the result units are Reported, Conventional, or SI (international). Since the FHIR model does not have an attribute for this, either transmit one type of result, in the agreed upon class, or provide a unit of measure system on the result values. Alternatively, the unit of measure may provide an indication of the result class.

element.gap: Derive this from the unit of measure system (on the result value), provide only one type of result, or provide a way to differentiate which results are reported, conventional, or international units. In some cases, the result unit of measure may provide some indication of whether the results are in conventional or SI.

element.name: Prior Medical History Event

cdisc.label: MHPRIOR
cdisc.description:
Prior Medical History Event
Prior Medical History Event

cdisc.label: MHSTRTPT; MHSTRF
cdisc.description: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTMIG relative timing variable such as MHSTRF or MHSTRTPT. When populating MHSTRF, or MHSTRTPT if the value of the CDASH field MHPRIOR is "Y" a value from the CDISC CT (STENRF) may be used. When MHPRIOR refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC) the SDTMIG variable MHSTRF should be populated. When MHPRIOR is compared to another time point, the SDTMIG variables MHSTRTPT and MHSTTPT should be used.

cdisc.label: MHENRF; MHENRTPT
cdisc.description: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTMIG relative timing variable such as MHENRF or MHENRTPT. When populating MHENRF, if the value of the MHONGO is "Y" a value of "DURING", "AFTER" or "DURING/AFTER" may be used. When populating MHENRTPT, if the value of MHONGO is "Y", the value of "ONGOING" may be used. When MHONGO refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM>RFSTDTC to DM>RFENDTC) the SDTMIG variable MHENRF should be populated.

cdisc.label: CMCAT
cdisc.description: The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

element.comment: In FHIR, an medication can be categorized in multiple ways and to the granularity desired. When converting from FHIR to CDASH, systems will need to look at the FHIR categories (and potentially other information) to determine how best to populate CMCAT and CMSCAT based on the study-designed categories (unless they've pre-arranged with the EHR to ensure it captures the same codes)

element.name: Related AdverseEvent ID

element.comment: This could match on AdverseEvent by code. (Note that the AdverseEvent points to the medication record, not the reverse

This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in the AdverseEvent domain.

element.name: Concomitant Meds Dose Description

cdisc.label: CMDSTXT
cdisc.description: The dose of medication/treatment taken per administration.

cdisc.description: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. Numeric values map to CMDOSE in SDTM. Non-numeric values (e.g., 200 - 400) map to CMDOSTXT in SDTM.

element.comment: Requires combining multiple repetitions together

cdisc.description: The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

element.name: Concomitant Meds Start Date

cdisc.label: CMSTDTC
cdisc.description: Record the date the concomitant [medication/treatment] was first taken using this format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY). If the subject has been taking the concomitant [medication/treatment for a considerable amount of time prior to the start of the study, it is acceptable to have an incomplete date. Concomitant [medication/treatment] taken during the study are expected to have a complete start date. Prior concomitant [medication/treatment] that are exclusionary should have both a start and end date.

cdisc.label: CMSTDTC
cdisc.description: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission datasets, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CDSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

element.comment: start includes both date and time, though time commonly won't be pecified

element.name: Concomitant Meds Start Time

element.comment: start includes both date and time, though time commonly won't be pecified

cdisc.label: CMSTDTC
cdisc.description: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission datasets, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CMSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

element.comment: end includes both date and time, though time commonly won't be pecified

cdisc.description: An indication whether or not the subject had any procedures performed

cdisc.label: (Y/N)

element.gap: This likely to be a Questionnaire question than something that would directly be captured in a record. It could be the answer to an Observation, but even then it would be qualified by type and time-range (procedure covers education, massage, cognitive therapy and various other data)

element.name: Procedure Category

cdisc.label: PRCAT
cdisc.description: A grouping of topic variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

cdisc.label: PRCAT
cdisc.description: The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

element.comment: FHIR doesn't have 2 distinct category levels. Instead, Procedure.category repeats. The option exists to have as many categorizations with whatever axes and granularities needed or desired. When mapping data to a particular study, it would be necessary to decide what category values best correspond to CAT vs. SCAT.

element.name: Procedure Subcategory

cdisc.label: SUPPPR.QVAL

element.comment: Note that reasonReference would need to be turned into a code or string. Reason[x] indicates reason for doing the procedure; statusReason when status=not-done would be reason for non-occurrence

cdisc.label: PRREASND

cdisc.label: PRREASND
cdisc.description: The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

element.name: Prior Procedure

cdisc.label: PRPRIOR
cdisc.description: Indicate the procedure occurred prior to [PRSTTPT] or prior to the date in DM RFSTDTC

cdisc.label: PRSTRTPT; PRSTRF
cdisc.description: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTM relative timing variable such as PRSTRF or PRSTRTPT. When populating PRSTRF, or PRSTRTPT, if the value of the CDASH field PRPRIOR is "Y" a value from the CDISC CT (STENRF) may be used.

element.gap:
This is not expect to receive from the site.
This is not expect to receive from the site.

element.name: Procedure Start Date

cdisc.label: PRSTDAT
cdisc.description: The date or start date of when the procedure started or was performed, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY)

cdisc.label: PRSTDTC
cdisc.description: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PRSTDTC in ISO 8601 format

element.comment: PerformedString and performedRange don't allow exact mappings (the latter indicates uncertainty about timing)

element.name: Ongoing Procedure

cdisc.label: PRONGO
cdisc.description: Indication the procedure is ongoing when no end date is provided

cdisc.label: PRENRTPT; PRENRF
cdisc.description: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTMIG relative timing variable such as PRENRF or PRENRTPT. When populating PRENRF, if the value of PRONGO is "Y", the value of "DURING", "AFTER" or "DURING/AFTER" may be used. When populating PRENRTPT, if the value of PRONGO is "Y", the value of "ONGOING" may be used. When PRONGO refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC) the SDTM variable PRENRF should be populated. When PRONGO is used in conjunction with another time point, the SDTM variable PRENRRPT and PRENTPT should be used

element.comment:
This supports the necessity of separating procedures and medication.
This supports the necessity of separating procedures and medication.

element.comment: PerformedString and performedRange don't allow exact mappings (the latter indicates uncertainty about timing)

element.gap: An administration could be based on more than one thing (recommendation, plan, order) and in theory the intended dose would be different for each.

When PRDOSADJ is collected, does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED> When PRADJ is to collected, the sponsor may suit this variable as a SUPPQ.

element.gap: This would be handled as an extension. Would appear on Procedure/MedicationAdministration/MedicationStatement.basedOn. Might consider proposing it as a standard extension.

element.gap: Not all potential mapping/FHIR resources/attributes will be addressed in this implementation guide. All data requires review and analysis to ensure the data is relevant and understood.

element.name: Procedure Interrupted

cdisc.label: PRITRPYN
cdisc.description: An indication whether the procedure was interrupted
Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM a CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

element.comment: If something is currently interrupted, the status would either be on-hold or stopped. If there was a temporary interruption and the procedure has since resumed or completed, the only way to detect the interruption would be an extension or to review the history.

element.name: Reason Procedure Interrupted

cdisc.label: PRITRPRS
cdisc.description: An indication of why the intervention was interrupted

cdisc.label: SUPPPR.QVAL
cdisc.description: This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset as the value of SUPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM = "PRITRPRS" and SUPPPR.QLABEL = "Reason intervention Interrupted". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variable.

element.comment: If the status is on-hold or stopped, statusReason would convey the reason. If there was a temporary interruption and the procedure has since resumed or completed, the only way to detect the interruption would be an extension or to review the history.

element.name: Procedure Interruption Duration

cdisc.label: SUPPPR.QVAL

element.gap: This would have to be an extension. Typically, you'd just look at history to see when something was suspended, then resumed.

element.name: Procedure Interruption Duration Units

cdisc.label: PRCINTDU
cdisc.description: The unit for the collected duration of the procedure interruption

cdisc.label: SUPPPR.QVAL
cdisc.description: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset as the value of SPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM = "PRITRPD" and SUPPPR.QLABEL = "Interruption Duration". Concatenate the collected procedure interruption duration and the duration unit components and create PRITRPD using ISO 8601.

element.gap: This would have to be part of the previous extension. Typically, reviewing the history of the procedure will indicate if it was suspended and then resumed.

element.name: Age Units

cdisc.label: AGEU
cdisc.description: The units of time that are routinely used to express the age of a person

cdisc.label: AGEU
cdisc.description: The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

element.gap: Age can be captured as an Observation as a point-in-time assessment, but generally this is simply calculated from birthDate

cdisc.description:
Demographics Collection Date
Demographics Collection Date

cdisc.label: DMDTC
cdisc.description: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission data set, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable BRTHDTC in ISO 860 format.

element.name: Sex

cdisc.label: SEX
cdisc.description: Sex of the subject as determined by the investigator.

cdisc.label: SEX
cdisc.description: The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

element.comment: Note that gender represents the gender for administrative purposes. Genetic, physiologic, social and other gender aspects are captured as Observations

element.name: Ethnicity

cdisc.label: ETHNIC
cdisc.description: A social group characterized by a distinctive social and cultural tradition maintained from generation to generation, a common history and origin and a sense of identification with the group; members of the group have distinctive features in their way of life, shared experiences and often a common genetic heritage; these features may be reflected in their experience of health and disease.

cdisc.label: ETHNIC
cdisc.description: The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

element.gap: There's a U.S. Core extension (https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/US-Core-R4/StructureDefinition-us-core-ethnicity.html) for this to capture ethnicity as required by U.S. legislation. It captures two distinct granularities as well as free text. Depending on the study, the higher or lower granularity might map to ETHNIC and the lower or free text could map to CETHNIC. Other countries use vastly different value sets or prohibit collection. If captured for clinical rather than administrative purposes, this would be an Observation

element.name: Collected Ethnicity

cdisc.label: CETHNIC
cdisc.description: A social group characterized by a distinctive social and cultural tradition maintained from generation to generation, a common history and origin and a sense of identification with the group; members of the group have distinctive features in their way of life, shared experiences and often a common genetic heritage; these features may be reflected in their experience of health and disease.

cdisc.label: SUPPDM.QVAL
cdisc.description: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPDM dataset as the value of SUPPDM.QVAL where SUPPDM.QNAM = "CETHIC" and SUPPDM.QLABEL = "Collected Ethnicity" See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 5, DM Domain. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

element.gap: There's a U.S. Core extension (https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/US-Core-R4/StructureDefinition-us-core-ethnicity.html) for this to capture ethnicity as required by U.S. legislation. It captures two distinct granularities as well as free text. Depending on the study, the higher or lower granularity might map to ETHNIC and the lower or free text could map to CETHNIC. Other countries use vastly different value sets or prohibit collection. If captured for clinical rather than administrative purposes, this would be an Observation

element.name: Race

cdisc.label: RACE
cdisc.description: An arbitrary classification based on physical characteristics, a group of persons related by common descent or heredity (U.S. Center for Disease Control).

cdisc.label: RACE
cdisc.description: The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

element.gap:
There's a U.S. Core extension (https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/US-Core-R4/StructureDefinition-us-core-race.html) for this to capture race as required by U.S. legislation. In theory, the OMBRace could map to RACE, 'detailed' could map to CRACE and 'text' could map to RACEOTH. However, how appropriate these mappings would be would depend on the study requirements.

element.name: Race Other

cdisc.label: RACEOTH
cdisc.description: A free text field to be used when none of the preprinted values for RACE are applicable or if another, unprinted selection should be added to those preprinted values.

This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPDM dataset as the value of SUPPDM.QVAL where SUPPDM.QNAM = "RACEOTHER" and SUPPDM.QLABEL = "RACE OTHER" See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 5, DM Domain. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
